paper_abstract: Let D subset of R-2 be a polygonal domain, H be a subdomain of D and f is an element of C-1((D) over bar - (H) over circle). In this paper we propose a method to reconstruct f over the whole (D) over bar using a technique based on the minimization of an energy functional J More precisely, we construct a new C-1-Powell-Sabin spline function f* over (D) over bar that approximates f outside H, and fills the hole off inside H. The resulting filling patch strongly depends on the values of two smoothing parameters involved in the functional J. We give a criteria to select optimum values of the parameters and we present some graphical and numerical examples. (C) 2010 IMACS. Published by Elsevier E.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A hole filling method for surfaces by using C-1-Powell-Sabin splines. Estimation of the smoothing parameters
